data.title: Allied+Soviet double base war factory menu need to add one MCV
data.body:

But, i think MCV on Allied or Soviet can build different buildings, and the different buildings build different units. So there should be two MCV icon, one build Allied MCV and the other build Soviet MCV.

data.body:
Implement (new) IPreventsTeleport in MadTank.
Prevents MadTank from being teleported after deployment.

data.title: WIP predefined upgrade strings.
data.body:
- Adds 2 interfaces: `INotifyExitCargo` and `INotifyEnterCargo` (used in Passenger)
- Adds interface `IResolvePredefinedUpgrades` (could possibly be reflected for docs), does not enforce a dictionary or any other specific implementation
- Passenger now handles upgrades for Cargo
- The commit message explains the test changes present which will of course be removed before merging

I'm sure this has quite a ways to go but I'd rather open this PR than let the feature rot.

**Help Wanted:**
I would like to match the `[name]`, `[weight]`, `[type]`, etc values via Regex which will allow strings such as `passenger.[name].[weight]` → `passenger.e1.1`.
Currently there can only be one replacement in each string as I iterate over the available substitutions in a poor manner.
_Note:_ I use dot notation as a preference, it is not enforced.
`passenger.e1 -- weight(1)` is viable if something grants `passenger.[name] -- weight([weight])`

**Ingame Testing:** _Tiberian Sun_
GDI's `GAVULC` is a `Cargo` actor with a `MaxWeight` of 2, so go ahead and throw some **infantry** in there.

``` yaml
GAVULC:
    Cargo:
        Types: Infantry
        PipCount: 2
        MaxWeight: 2
    Armament@PRIMARY:
        Weapon: VulcanTower
        RestrictedByUpgrade: passenger.Infantry
    Armament@WEIGHT:
        Weapon: EMPulseCannon
        RequiresUpgrade: passenger.weight.2 #Testing: Umagon's weight is 2
    Armament@E3:
        Weapon: SAMTower
        RequiresUpgrade: passenger.e3

^Infantry:
    Passenger:
        GrantUpgrades: passenger.[type], passenger.[name], passenger.weight.[weight]
```

**Technical Notes:**
The Passenger impl uses a a simple `Dictionary<string, string>` for the time being, so every substitution must become a string somehow.

data.title: NRE in player pinger code
data.body:
```
Exception of type `System.NullReferenceException`: Object reference not set to an instance of an object
  at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Server.PlayerPinger.Tick (OpenRA.Server.Server server) [0x000a9] in /home/ubuntu/OpenRA/OpenRA.Mods.Common/ServerTraits/PlayerPinger.cs:44
  at OpenRA.Server.Server.<Server>m__0 (System.Object _) [0x001ff] in /home/ubuntu/OpenRA/OpenRA.Game/Server/Server.cs:184
  at System.Threading.Thread.StartInternal () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
```

Crashes my dedicated server. Appears in the current release.

$10 says GetClient(c) is returning null at line 44 of PlayerPinger.cs

```
server.SendMessage(server.GetClient(c).Name + " is experiencing connection problems.");
```

<bountysource-plugin>

---

Want to back this issue? **[Place a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/5968442-nre-in-player-pinger-code?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: CnC mod: Toggling BuildAll cheat switches Queues to GDI
data.body: The cheat always gives you GDI build options (and removes Nod options), even if you chose Nod as faction.

data.title: Including separators or tooltips in choosing your team...
data.body:
It's an idea, and there's probably easier jury-rig ways of doing it, but what if there's a way to demonstrate on the team selection menu if specific teams belong to a greater "faction" class?

For example, instead of:

Germany
France
England
Russia
Ukraine

Something to visualize what factions the team belongs to:

Allied/
 Germany
 France
 England
# 

Soviet/
 Russia
 Ukraine

It doesn't even have to be tied to the technology the teams use. I just think it's a neat visual polish if the modder wants to go the route of making X factions with Y teams in each, versus a whole pool of Z teams (though it helps people identify which teams use what technology).

Alternatively, maybe a tooltip box when hovering over a team (or divider) to learn about them before selecting them?

data.title: Workarounds for a bug in certain versions of Mono (3.10 and certain versions of 3.8) which stops OpenRA building
data.body:
[happy0@gamma OpenRA]$ make
CSC OpenRA.Game.exe
OpenRA.Game/Exts.cs(378,6): error CS1525: Unexpected symbol `?'
Compilation failed: 1 error(s), 0 warnings
Makefile:249: recipe for target 'OpenRA.Game.exe' failed
make: **\* [OpenRA.Game.exe] Error 1
[happy0@gamma OpenRA]$ mono -V
Mono JIT compiler version 3.10.0 (tarball Mon Oct  6 20:46:04 UTC 2014)

Mono bug report : https://bugzilla.xamarin.com/show_bug.cgi?id=23319 (it appears to have been resolved in master so shouldn't be present in future versions of Mono)

Mono 3.10 seems to be unhappy with ternary statements of a certain format, so I desugared those breaking the build into if statements (and OpenRA subsequently built.)

I wasn't sure whether you would accept this pull request, since I'm not sure whether changing code to work around compiler bugs is even a good idea, but I thought I'd give you guys the option anyway. Arguably the code is a bit more readable this way anyway :P. Up to you!

data.title: Actor properties consistency improved
data.body: A step towards unit testing

data.title: Allied Artillery-Centered Over-Advantage should be nerfed...
data.body:
I'm sorry if I'm saying this, and I'm perfectly aware how to counter artillery with Soviets, blind them by shooting their helicopter spotter / sniffing out their phase transports.

But then, it always end up in a race against time in 1 vs 1 situation, you got to defeat or at least severely cripple your Allied enemy BEFORE your enemy turn on their GPS, and because longbows can attack air, using yaks/migs to micro-kill artilleries is negated late game, making an essentially stalemated endgame very difficult to win unless you prepare a nuke silo first.... because after GPS kicked in, all your enemy needs to do is spam artillery with longbow guards and use their range advantage to basecreep toward your base.

Well, the very obvious solution, but a rather unnerving one (if historically used by Soviet Union, may I add) is throw cannon fodders at them, a lot of riflemen with few heavy tanks and rocket soldiers to distract them, preferably somewhere else, but still, there is a single thing named Tanya that could practically mow down whole group of infantry by themselves. And GPS causing them to not diverting their artilleries because they knew it is mostly infantry and just sent tanya with rocket soldiers and medics.

And even mammoth tanks is hard to go there, because when their riflemen / rocket soldiers screen are depleted by long range artilleries, they themselves end up sitting ducks against enemy rocket soldiers.

Before GPS kicking in, even with their less range, properly microed V2 (with some lucks because it's blind firing / supported by expendable Yaks as well) can somehow deter them from attacking, but with GPS, artilleries did not need any "spotters" again, and they can reign free with their 14 range of attack.

So may I suggest some balance workaround to lessen the Allied late-game advantage? Only one of these is needed though IMHO.

1) Either reduce artillery range to 10 (the same as V2) or increase V2 range to 14 (increase their price if needed too) - level up their range playing field, just like Cruisers and Missile Subs have equal 16 range

2) Turn off Tanya's auto-target (so she should end up like how she behave originally), making a big infantry distraction more viable tactics - forcing the allied to sacrifice concentrated artillery barrage for taking care of infantry horde at the other "front"

3) Either give Mig Air-to-Air capability, or turn off Longbow's air-to-air capability, so air power against artillery is still a viable tactic late game. - So guarding artilleries with longbows is now less viable option.

4) Either remove Allied GPS, or give Gap Generators to Soviets - I'm not sure on this one, but with fog of war on, Soviets are still practically blind late game, either blind the Allies or give Soviets way to blind the GPS.

Thanks for reading.

<bountysource-plugin>

---

Want to back this issue? **[Place a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/5888600-allied-artillery-centered-over-advantage-should-be-nerfed?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: choppy gameplay
data.body:
I'm experiencing choppy gameplay when I play against the AI (skirmish). I've never played a network game, so I can't tell if happens there as well. It happens in every single game I play. It happens with both bleed and master branches. It's very, very noticable. I don't think it's a hardware problem as I have a relatively high end system build (Intel Core i7-4578 Haswell, 16GB RAM, SSD).

Do you guys have any idea what could be the cause of this? If I know what I'm looking for (approximatelly), I may be able to dig deeper into it.
